name: Commander Keen
description: Commander Keen: Invasion of the Vorticons: Episode 1: Marooned on Mars (Dec. 14th 1990) Episode 2: The Earth Explodes (1991) Episode 3: Keen Must Die! (1991) Commander Keen's very first adventure, and the debut of id's groundbreaking side-scrolling technology.

reviews.review_text: BETTER THAN MASS EFFECT  Commander Keen saved Earth a generation before Commander Shepard ever heard of the Reapers. Little dude built his own space ship out of soup cans. Shepard struggled building a fish tank. This 8 year-old kid was clearing out the Vorticon home planet while Shepard was telling everyone what his favorite shop on the Citadel was.  Shepard is a joke. Commander Keen is the real Spectre.

One of the first games I ever played, so I was glad to find it on Steam.  It's a nice platformer, but can't do much more than jump and shoot straight forward. Try to avoid the gaps and collect as many points as you can (not as easy as it sounds mind you ;) ) Since everything kills you in one hit, prepare to start some levels over and over again. But considering the age of this game, it's still very entertaining (come on you know you love MS-Dos)

Pros:  -It's a classic. -Bobby Prince musicz. -Doesn't require DOSBOX to run.  Cons:  -I wish I was 5 again.  I used to pk  unzip,dir/w , and cd.. when I was 5 years old instead of slapping cartridges into a shoebox. The PC Masterrace was strong in me at a tender age and ID software, Apogee, and Epic Megagames are to blame.

A must-have for classic game lovers. Has great controls, the right difficulty and a weird, yet funny story. So, if you like colorful old-school platformers or are looking for a nostalgia rush, you won't go wrong with this one.
The nostalgia is real. Although i'm still as bad as when I played this series 15 years ago...

Brings back memories of my childhood. Loved these games. Great little bundle. Pity it doesn't have Episode 6: Aliens Ate My Baby Sitter! & Keen Dream - which was all always my favourite. Still very happy with this pack though.

An old classic game series made by ID software and published by apogee which admittingly i wasted way too much time on as a kid. This pack features 5 games made by ID software and for the current price it's almost a give-away.  Qua controls it can be challenging at various times so be patient with this part you can definatly get the hang of it, The keys are for the rest simple and straight forwarded though the pogostick is the hardest of all to control. Give it some time even i had problems with it when i fired the game back up after so many years.  For those familiar with the keen series it should be noted that the commander keen complete series for steam does not contain all the official games but instead only the games made by ID software and apogee. For more details here is a small list:  ======Included: 1. 1 Marooned on Mars 1. 2 The Earth Explodes 1. 3 Keen Must Die 2. 1 Secret of the Oracle 2. 2 The armageddon machine  ======Not included: The Lost Episode aka keen dreams (softdisk) Aliens Ate My Babysitter (formgen) Commander keen Gameboy color (David A. Palmer Productions)  With all that out of the way i'd like to mention one more thing before i end this review. Ever heard of the term: Dopefish Lives? Perhaps you've seen an easter egg of it in one of your favorite games or childhood cartoons even. If you do this is where it all started. Go ahead and play the secret of the oracle, it will find you eventually ;)  All the best!  (s.i.e)

I played these games a lot as a kid.  They're still fun and challenging to this day.  Character and level design are great and have a lot of charm.  If you're a fan of retro platformers or classic DOS games this is a must!  Make sure to save often, there is no autosave!

This is a childhood classic and a must play! All the way from 8bit music to pogosticks and pooping slugs! Seriously, you can't go wrong with this game. (There are lazer guns in this game if that helps any.)
Coolest platformer tbh

11/10  'Comander KEEN!'   There was Mario, Sonic and  Commander Keen.    Pros:  + superb classic Jump'n'Run + setting & atmosphere + graphics + sounds + controls + gaming history + childhood memories   Must have in every Jump'N'Run Collection (at least when you were born in the '80s).
Classic side scroller from the 90s. Fun, simple, explorative, and easy to play.

Play as Commander Keen and save the Earth from the alien invasion with nothing more than a neural stunner and a pogo stick. A game for all the lovers of old-school platformers (Sonic, Mario, Jazz Jackrabbit) out there.  The only bad thing about this game is that keen is as fragile as a piece of tissue paper (dies in one hit), but otherwise this game is top notch.  Episodes 1-3 are okay, but if you want the best of the best in the series then play Episodes 4 and 5, which are have better graphics, levels and gameplay.

The Commander Keen Games are one of the first I´ve ever played. I loved them then and I love them now even more. The charm and the humor is something you rarely see in todays games. I highly recommend it.

Before there was Doom... before there was Quake... before there was even Wolfenstein 3-D... there was Commander Keen. id Software's roots can be traced to this classic DOS series of games that surprisingly, even to this day, is pretty fun to play and still holds up well (unless you're not used to old-school keyboard controls, then you're on your own).
Great classic series. A little slice of my childhood.

If you are a die-hard Commander Keen fan, then this pack is for you. If you are a casual fan who wants some feelings of nostalgia, save your money. While I do appreciate Steam making it easy to launch and play the game (Dosbox is setup internally), this complete pack does not include all of the games. You also still get the advertising in game and the first few Commander Keen games are so basic and minimal that it only brought me feelings of frustration, not nostalgia.

Patching this piece of awesomeness is like sticking your d*ck in an electrical outlet. Releasing such a buggy and not complete product should be illegal... and why the f*ck is it called 'COMPLETE PACK' when there is no 6th episode? Oh... and steam version has some problems with sound. Great.  It should be 9/10 but because steam version is such a piece of sh*t and without patches and f*cking around with (deleting/changing/moving/creating) folders... its almost unplayable. 6+/10  P.S. CGenius is a must have.
Is this guy bald? I wanna remove his helmet.
Another game from my childhood that I loved. A must have for any 90s babbies (No, you who were born at the end of the 90s ARE NOT 90s KIDS!!!)
i getting a small screen when i playing and not a fullscreen! can someone help me?
Does not work on my Windows 10 machine as of 2/9/16

I bought this because I love Commander Keen, but what I got...yeah, what is that, exactly, ID? What did I pay for, here? What did you actually  do ? I paid 5€ for something I played for free over 20 years ago, as far as I can tell. I wanted a trip down memory-lane, this was too real.  5€ is a small price to pay for the many hours I spent on these games as a kid and so I didn't refund, but if you don't just want this for nostalgia (and probably even then), save your money.
Filth.
I couldn't believe what I was seeing. Commander Keen returns to us at the time of need! O frabjous day! Gallooh! Gallay! I chortled in my joy.
Commander Keen was one of the first games I've ever played and it's still damn good!

I love the Keen games, so classic and still so much fun. Yes! Keen 6 and Keen Dreams are missing, but there is still countless hours of fun to be had with the games in this pack. Well worth the price.
If you haven't played Commander Keen, then you haven't lived.

This is one of the most epic and funniest and often also most frustrating Jump'n Run I ever played - and also one of my first. I still had it on Dosbox, but now on Steam with Steam Cloud it sounds actually even better. :D
you can find these on abandonware sites for free get them from there instead
Every Big Company starts with a sometimes forgotten Masterpiece. Make ID yours!

OH MY GOSH! this totaly just took me back to my childhood. it is jsut as good as you might remember. oldschool and hasnt changed a bit. although it did take me a minute to get used to the menu(having not been updated) but got a hang of it quickly. when playing it you can definatelly see how far we have come with out current video games.
I'm Commander Keen and this is my favorite side-scroller on steam.
Fantastic old school pc platform filled with quirky Apogee humor.
Best platformer of all time. Truly a must have.
one of the all time greatest platform jumping games in history. played as a child play as an adult.
A fantastic set of games from my childhood. Think of it as a failed Mario rival but with a gun and pogo-stick.
This is my child hood right here.... I love it then and i love it now still with its 1080P graphics they amaze me everytime 11/10 for the retro gamer
First Game I ever played. This is what got me into gaming.
Keen rocks the planet. Old but excellent!

Ahhh, the memories return once more~ And it is so (frustratingly) good. I missed these games so much. Glad to see them on Steam.  One thing, though. Lags and Stutters. All over the place (I run Win8 right now).   It was maddening and the lags made it unplayable, until I eventually searched the forums for a solution, and now everything is a-ok.   I hope there's a patch coming soon. Otherwise, good idea, putting this up on the store!
Old school classic game .

This r teh game war u blow teh things up. Small Child 'CAPTIN FOOTBALLHELMET' is herro 4 galxy nd he shots lazors. Lazors don't stop the swallowing fish from SMB3 though so look our 4 it. He isn' t a robot eitehr like everything else. Gaem presented in ULTRA-HI-BIT EVGA grafics. I particularly liek teh whit n magnetas tones.
First game i ever played. Controls = horrible, if you didn't play theese as a kid, don't bother now.

Kind of upset to find out after the fact this 'complete pack' is missing Episode 6: Alien's ate my Babysitter' and the lost episode: 'Keen Dreams' but it's a really good trip down memory lane. Here's hoping the dev's might update the pack to at least include Ep. 6 since the lost episode is already available on steam but I won't be holding my breath.
F#(@ Classic.

The first smooth scrolling PC game, written by the guys who started the FPS genre. Yes, please. You can even play it on your 1981 PC with it's highly diverse 4 color pallette. If you can find a copy of the CGA Composite Edition of Keen 4 by VileR it's worth a look. If you're into getting wholly emotional about old tech.

Great value for the money; $1 per game.  Runs on DOSBox, so if you know what you're doing you can customize the settings and make it run optimally on your PC. Seems to run just fine out-of-the-box though.  Too bad it doesn't include  Aliens Ate My Baby Sitter! . Technically, it's not part of this series, so it's understandable. It's just a shame because it doesn't seem to be available to buy anywhere else.  Hopefully they can work in trading cards at some point in the future.
Where are my floppy disks? Oh never mind! Steam is the best. Nostalgia But I forgot that this game actually is a challenge!
Commander Keen is one of the greatest series of games I've ever played. Maybe it's my nostalgia but it still feels like it's a very strong platformer with a fun gameplay 10/10
Best sidescoll platformer game ever
